messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Brian Button <bbutton@...> wrote:
>
> sam.gribbles wrote:
> > Hi All,
> >
> > I'm new to Junit testing and have been able to do some basic
testing
> > etc.
> > What I want to do now is test for objects that are returned in
random
> > order. E.G. I have a few Fortune Cookies that are stored in an
array of
> > Strings. I've written some code that returns them randomly.
> > What is the best method for testing? i.e. should I be using Mocks?
> > If anybody has any good examples or relevant web sites please let
me
> > know.
>
> Sam,
>
> When faced with a question like this, I always ask, "What are you
trying
> to test?"
>
> Are you trying to test your randomness algorithm or trying to test
that
> you can return a fortune given an index and that index happens to
be random.
>
> My best advice is to split the problem in half. Don't try to test
> returning a random fortune. Test that, given a sequence of
fortunes, you
> can return the next one when asked. In your test system, you can
set up
> a known sequence of fortunes, and in your real system, you can set
up a
> random sequence. Hide the sequence generation behind an interface
and
> you can mock it for tests, and use real randomness in production.
>
> I hope this makes sense :) If not, ask away again.
>
> bab

Thanks Brian,

I've posted a response to all which explains what I'm trying to do
more clearly.
Your response does make sense however. I'll have a think about it and
try to come up with the best way of implementing a solution.

Cheers,

Sam.
